title: Sexy times ahead: 5 aphrodisiac recipes to try this Valentine's Day : Food, News - India Today
text:
A + A - Picture courtesy: www.thefoodcharlatan.com 
With the day of love--aka Valentine's Day--around the corner, there's nothing better than enlisting the help of aphrodisiac foods to get you in the right mood. 
Known for their libido boosting properties, consumption of foods with aphrodisiac properties can help enhance your fertility and sexual desire. Who knows, passionate lovemaking could be a choco lava cake away. 
Also read: 5 romantic getaways for this Valentine's Day 
Chocolate 
With chemicals like tryptophan and phenylethylamine found in its composition, chocolate is considered an aphrosidiac. Phenylethylamine is also known as the love drug, so we suggest you bake this Molten Choco Lava Cake (found here) to make the most of the day of love. Picture courtesy: www.giverecipe.com 
Strawberry 
The lovely fruit has been considered an aphrodisiac by ancient Romans and the food is known to boost your sex drive. Why not serve this Coconut Strawberry Daiquiri (found here ) for a cooler that heats things up between you and your lover. Picture courtesy: www.foodfanatic.com 
Banana 
Bananas contain bromelain, an enzyme that's known for its libido-boosting properties. The phallic fruit is widely cited for its ability to improve fertility in males. Try these Banana Churros with Chocolate Peanut Butter Sauce (found here ) for a saucy dessert.
